div.l: But feir͗e and well she crept in to þe clerke
And light ful stille and wold have caught a slep̄e
Withyn̄ a while þis Iohn þe clerke vp leep̄e
And on þis gode wyfe he leyth on sore
So mery a fyt ne hedde she not ful yore
He priketh hard and depe as he were madde
This Ioly lyfe han þis two clerkys ledde
Tyl þat þe third Cok by gan to synge
Aleyn wax wery in þe dawnynge
For he hedde swonken al þe longe nyght
And seide farewel Malkyn my swete wyght
Þe day is come y may no lenger bide
But ever more where soeủer y go or ryde
I am þyn owne clerk so have I swell
Now dere lemmāan qduod she go farewell
But er thou go oon þyng wol I the tell
Whan þat þou wendest home · by þe mille
Right at þe entre at þe dore by hynde
Þou shalt a kake of half a busschel fynde
Þat was y maked of þyn owne mele
Which þat i help my sire to stele
And goode lemmāan god þe save and kepe
And with þat word sho gan almost to wepe
Aleyn vp rist and þought er it were dawe
I wol go crepen in by my felawe
And founde þe Cradel with his honde anon̄
By god thought he al wrong I have mysgon̄
Myn hed is totie of my swynk to nyght
Þat makeþ me þat y go nought a right
I wotwel by þe Cradel y have mysgo
Here lith þe Miller and his wife also
And forth he goth a twenty develewey
Vnto þe bedde þer as þe Miller lay
He wend have crepen by his felaw Iohn
And by þe Miller in he crepe anon̄
And caught him by þe nekke and softe spake
He seyd þou Iohn þou swyneshede a wake
For cristes sowle and here a noble game
For by þat lord þat called is seynt Iame
As I have thries þis short nyght
